reference.shortdesc: The coords element specifies the coordinates of a linkable region in an imagemap.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The values for use in the coords element are defined by the HTML5 specification. The unit used for coordinates is CSS pixels. The following table provides a summary of the syntax, which depends on the shape of the linkable region:

strow.stentry:
Three integers, separated by commas:
The distance from the left edge of the image to the center of the circle
The distance from the top edge of the image to the center of the circle
The radius of the circle
The default shape is the entire image. The coords element should be empty.

An even number of at least six integers, separated by commas:
Each pair of integers represents a coordinate given as the distances from the left and the top of the image respectively.
The coordinates represent the points of the polygon, in order.

Four integers, separated by commas:
The distance from the left edge of the image to the left side of the rectangle
The distance from the top edge of the image to the top side of the rectangle
The distance from the left edge of the image to the right side of the rectangle
The distance from the top edge of the image to the bottom side of the rectangle

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The coords element is specialized from ph. It is defined in the utilities-domain module.
